title: Hanks Sends The White House Press Corps A Welcomed Gift
text:
Hanks Sends The White House Press Corps A Welcomed Gift "Keep up the good fight for Truth, Justice..." by Randy DeSoto March 2, 2017 at 12:31pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Tom Hanks sent a brand new espresso machine to the White House press corp with the exhortation to “keep up the good fight for truth.” 
Multiple reporters expressed their appreciation to the Academy Award winning actor for his kind gesture. 
Along with the new coffee machine was a note which read, “To the White House Press Corps: Keep up the good fight for Truth, Justice, and the American Way. Especially for the Truth part.” Advertisement - story continues below 
— Karen Travers (@karentravers) March 2, 2017 
The current machine replaces one Hanks gifted the press corps in 2010 during the Obama administration, which replaced one he gave them in 2004, while President George W. Bush was in office. . @TomHanks sends White House reporters espresso machine and a cheerful note https://t.co/A7WszobWIW pic.twitter.com/VP0vDvxGmj 
— Hollywood Reporter (@THR) March 2, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below 
The actor noticed during a visit to the White House in ’04 that the reporters were getting their java from a traditional coffee maker. 
“I hope this machine will make the 24 hour cycle of news a bit more pleasant,” he wrote in a note to corps at the time. “Add water, insert pod, press button and report. All good things. Tom Hanks.” 
Hanks’ note this time included a World War II era cartoon captioned, “Fresh, spirited American troops, flushed with victory, are bringing in thousands of hungry, ragged, battle-weary prisoners.” The note that accompanied the new coffee maker from @tomhanks pic.twitter.com/Qfkli2TgCt 
— Jordan Fabian (@Jordanfabian) March 2, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below
